definition: value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty

sentences.english: I am on the night shift every Wednesday.
sentences.chinese: 我每逢星期三都值夜班。

sentences.english: Relax", said the night-man, " We are programmed to receive.
sentences.chinese: “置松点，”值夜的说到，“我们部署恶了接受。

sentences.english: "Relax"said the night-man" We are programmed to receive.
sentences.chinese: “放松点，”值夜的说到，“我们都轻易受诱惑。

sentences.english: The man's cry aroused the town watch.
sentences.chinese: 那人的喊叫声惊醒了镇上的值夜人。

sentences.english: "Relax", said the night-man, " We are programmed to receive.
sentences.chinese: “放松点，”值夜的说到，“咱们摆设好了接收。

sentences.english: The off-duty watch relaxed under a lantern after the squall .
sentences.chinese: 狂风过后，下了班的值夜人员在一盏提灯下憩息。

sentences.english: The off-duty watch relaxed under a lantern after the squall.
sentences.chinese: 狂风过后，下了班的值夜人员在一盏提灯下憩息。

sentences.english: Can take night-shift while the business need.
He volunteered to stay on night shifts during the Mid-Autumn Festival holiday.
sentences.chinese: 中秋假期期间，他自愿留在单位值夜班。

sentences.english: 'Relax, ' said the night-man, " We are programmed to receive."
sentences.chinese: “放松点，”值夜的说到，“我们安排好了接收。

sentences.english: The night watchman makes his rounds every hour.
sentences.chinese: 值夜班的人每个小时都会到各处巡视一次。

sentences.english: If jade tonight unworthy night, seldom had the reproductive cycle of rest.
sentences.chinese: 如玉今晚不值夜，难得有了休息的空闲。

sentences.english: The night nurse and a guard greeted me at the door.
sentences.chinese: 值夜班的护士和一个守卫在门口接待了我。

sentences.english: One of the night-duty nuns gave her a sleeping draught.
sentences.chinese: 一个值夜班的修女给了她一剂安眠药水。

definition: to be on all-night duty/to be on night watch/to keep a vigil
to change shift/the next work shift/to relieve (a workman on the previous shift)/to take over the job
to keep watch/to do sentry duty/to be on patrol
(of a security guard etc) to be on duty, keeping an eye on things/to keep watch
to hold a lamp/to light a lamp
variant of 執勤|执勤[zhi2 qin2]
to go to bed/to retire for the night
